title: Global_Objects
markdown:
# Standard built-in objects

This chapter documents all of JavaScript's standard, built-in objects, including their methods and properties.

The term "global objects" (or standard built-in objects) here is not to be confused with **the global object**. Here, "global objects" refer to **objects in the global scope**.

The **global object** itself can be accessed using the [this](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/this) operator in the global scope. In fact, the global scope **consists of** the properties of the global object, including inherited properties, if any.

Other objects in the global scope are either [created by the user script](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Working%5Fwith%5Fobjects#creating%5Fnew%5Fobjects) or provided by the host application. The host objects available in browser contexts are documented in the [API reference](/en-US/docs/Web/API).

For more information about the distinction between the [DOM](/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document%5FObject%5FModel) and core [JavaScript](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript), see [JavaScript technologies overview](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/JavaScript%5Ftechnologies%5Foverview).

## [Standard objects by category](#standard%5Fobjects%5Fby%5Fcategory)

### [Value properties](#value%5Fproperties)

These global properties return a simple value. They have no properties or methods.

* [globalThis](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/globalThis)
* [Infinity](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Infinity)
* [NaN](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/NaN)
* [undefined](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/undefined)

### [Function properties](#function%5Fproperties)

These global functions—functions which are called globally, rather than on an object—directly return their results to the caller.

* [eval()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/eval)
* [isFinite()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/isFinite)
* [isNaN()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/isNaN)
* [parseFloat()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/parseFloat)
* [parseInt()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/parseInt)
* [decodeURI()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/decodeURI)
* [decodeURIComponent()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/decodeURIComponent)
* [encodeURI()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/encodeURI)
* [encodeURIComponent()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/encodeURIComponent)
* [escape()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/escape) Deprecated
* [unescape()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/unescape) Deprecated

### [Fundamental objects](#fundamental%5Fobjects)

These objects represent fundamental language constructs.

* [Object](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object)
* [Function](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Function)
* [Boolean](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Boolean)
* [Symbol](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Symbol)

### [Error objects](#error%5Fobjects)

Error objects are a special type of fundamental object. They include the basic [Error](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Error) type, as well as several specialized error types.

* [Error](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Error)
* [AggregateError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/AggregateError)
* [EvalError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/EvalError)
* [RangeError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/RangeError)
* [ReferenceError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/ReferenceError)
* [SyntaxError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/SyntaxError)
* [TypeError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypeError)
* [URIError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/URIError)
* [InternalError](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/InternalError) Non-standard

### [Numbers and dates](#numbers%5Fand%5Fdates)

These are the base objects representing numbers, dates, and mathematical calculations.

* [Number](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Number)
* [BigInt](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/BigInt)
* [Math](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Math)
* [Date](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Date)

### [Text processing](#text%5Fprocessing)

These objects represent strings and support manipulating them.

* [String](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/String)
* [RegExp](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/RegExp)

### [Indexed collections](#indexed%5Fcollections)

These objects represent collections of data which are ordered by an index value. This includes (typed) arrays and array-like constructs.

* [Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Array)
* [Int8Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Int8Array)
* [Uint8Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint8Array)
* [Uint8ClampedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint8ClampedArray)
* [Int16Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Int16Array)
* [Uint16Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint16Array)
* [Int32Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Int32Array)
* [Uint32Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint32Array)
* [BigInt64Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/BigInt64Array)
* [BigUint64Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/BigUint64Array)
* [Float32Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Float32Array)
* [Float64Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Float64Array)

### [Keyed collections](#keyed%5Fcollections)

These objects represent collections which use keys. The iterable collections ([Map](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Map) and [Set](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Set)) contain elements which are easily iterated in the order of insertion.

* [Map](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Map)
* [Set](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Set)
* [WeakMap](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/WeakMap)
* [WeakSet](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/WeakSet)

### [Structured data](#structured%5Fdata)

These objects represent and interact with structured data buffers and data coded using JavaScript Object Notation (JSON).

* [ArrayBuffer](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/ArrayBuffer)
* [SharedArrayBuffer](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/SharedArrayBuffer)
* [DataView](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/DataView)
* [Atomics](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Atomics)
* [JSON](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/JSON)

### [Managing memory](#managing%5Fmemory)

These objects interact with the garbage collection mechanism.

* [WeakRef](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/WeakRef)
* [FinalizationRegistry](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/FinalizationRegistry)

### [Control abstraction objects](#control%5Fabstraction%5Fobjects)

Control abstractions can help to structure code, especially async code (without using deeply nested callbacks, for example).

* [Iterator](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Iterator)
* [AsyncIterator](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/AsyncIterator)
* [Promise](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Promise)
* [GeneratorFunction](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/GeneratorFunction)
* [AsyncGeneratorFunction](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/AsyncGeneratorFunction)
* [Generator](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Generator)
* [AsyncGenerator](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/AsyncGenerator)
* [AsyncFunction](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/AsyncFunction)

### [Reflection](#reflection)

* [Reflect](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Reflect)
* [Proxy](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Proxy)

### [Internationalization](#internationalization)

Additions to the ECMAScript core for language-sensitive functionalities.

* [Intl](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl)
* [Intl.Collator](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/Collator)
* [Intl.DateTimeFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DateTimeFormat)
* [Intl.DisplayNames](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DisplayNames)
* [Intl.DurationFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/DurationFormat)
* [Intl.ListFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/ListFormat)
* [Intl.Locale](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/Locale)
* [Intl.NumberFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/NumberFormat)
* [Intl.PluralRules](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/PluralRules)
* [Intl.RelativeTimeFormat](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/RelativeTimeFormat)
* [Intl.Segmenter](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Intl/Segmenter)
